intro: Clidemia melanodesma, commonly known as velvetleaf or blackstem shrub, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually dark green and covered in a fine, velvety pubescence, giving it its common name. Clidemia melanodesma is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
